info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 9 at 3:38AM EDT by NWS Boston/Norton MA
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Connecticut...
Connecticut River At Middle Haddam affecting Middlesex County.
Connecticut River At Hartford affecting Hartford and Middlesex Counties.
For the Connecticut River...including Hartford, Middle Haddam... Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Connecticut River at Middle Haddam.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Flooding is expected in low lying sections along the Connecticut River from Wethersfield and Glastonbury downstream through Cromwell, Middletown and Portland. Boating interests should prepare for a period of swift river flows.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:55 AM EDT Friday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:55 AM EDT Friday was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage early this morning to 6.4 feet this evening. It will then rise to 6.9 feet late tonight. It will fall to 6.7 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then rise above flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 500 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE
